t: Psalm 49
The Confidence of the Foolish
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.
Hear*pn this, all peoples; Give*ld ear, all inhabitants of the world,
Both*ld low and high, Rich*ld and poor together.
My*ld mouth shall speak wisdom, And*ld the meditation of my heart shall*i give*i understanding.
I*ld will incline my ear to a proverb; I*ld will disclose my dark saying on the harp.
Why*ln should I fear in the days of evil, When*ild the iniquity at my heels surrounds me?
Those*ld who trust in their wealth And*ld boast in the multitude of their riches,
None*ld of*i them*i can by any means redeem his*i brother, Nor*ld give to God a ransom for him—
For*ld the redemption of their souls is*i costly, And*ld it shall cease forever—
That*ld he should continue to live eternally, And*ild not see the Pit.
For*ln he sees wise men die; Likewise*ld the fool and the senseless person perish, And*ld leave their wealth to others.
Their*ld inner thought is*i that*i their houses will*i last*i forever, Their*ld dwelling places to all generations; They*ld call their*i lands after their own names.
Nevertheless*ld man, though*i in honor, does not remain; He*ld is like the beasts that*i perish.
This*ln is the way of those who are*i foolish, And*ld of their posterity who approve their sayings. Selah*ipg

Like*ld sheep they are laid in the grave; Death*ld shall feed on them; The*ld upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; And*ld their beauty shall be consumed in the grave, far from their dwelling.
But*ld God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave, For*ld He shall receive me. Selah*ipg
Do*pn not be afraid when one becomes rich, When*ld the glory of his house is increased;
For*ld when he dies he shall carry nothing away; His*ld glory shall not descend after him.
Though*ld while he lives he blesses himself (For*ld men*i will praise you when you do well for yourself),
He*ld shall go to the generation of his fathers; They*ld shall never see light.
A*ld man who*i is*i in honor, yet does not understand, Is*ld like the beasts that*i perish.
